title: Iranian President Ebrahim Raissi to visit China to strengthen anti-Western axis
description: Though relations between the two countries are not idllyic, Iran is part of a network of alliances built by Beijing trying to counterbalance the hegemony of the United States.

title: One in five young French people has a depressive disorder
description: A survey by the French public health agency showed an increase in depressive episodes in 2021 across the population.

title: Syria agrees to open two more border crossings to facilitate aid to earthquake victims
description: Before the earthquake struck, almost all of the crucial humanitarian aid for the more than four million people living in northwestern Syria was being delivered from Turkey through one conduit.

title: US critizes Israeli plan to legalize occupied West Bank settlement outposts
description: Despite the rebuke, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken gave no indication that the Biden administration is prepared to take action.

title: Champions League final chaos: New report points out to 'very short deadline' and lack of call for applications
description: The independent report ordered by UEFA into the disaster at the 2022 Paris football match also singles out President Emmanuel Macron, who accepted the last-minute request to host the event.

title: War in Ukraine: 'Hatred has entered Russian families'
description: Almost a year after the invasion of Ukraine, Russians are not in favor of the war but are reluctant to stay informed and choose instead to follow Putin's propaganda, explains Alexei Venediktov the editor-in-chief of radio station Echo of Moscow.

title: Ukraine says fighting 'difficult' near Bakhmut as Russia claims gains
description: Ukraine has also called on the West to send more weapons as the one-year anniversary of Russia's invasion of Ukraine approaches.

title: French pension reform: Unions promise 'black day' on March 7
description: The alliance of eight unions and five youth organizations has vowed to 'bring France to a standstill' if the government continues its plans to increase the legal retirement age.

title: In China, anger mounts among retirees after their health insurance is cut
description: In a rare event in China, hundreds of elderly people demonstrated in the metropolis of Wuhan to complain about their social benefits being cut by a third.

title: Trial for Brussels attacks risks being hampered by dysfunction
description: Beyond its own failures, the mega-trial for the 2016 attacks raises disturbing questions regarding the Belgian authorities and their handling of the case.

title: 19 killed in Burkina Faso attacks
description: The attacks are the latest in a recent spate in the country, which has been ravaged by a jihadist insurgency that spilled over from neighboring Mali in 2015.

title: In Turkey, a humanitarian crisis looms one week after the earthquakes
description: As any hope of finding survivors fades, management of the disaster enters a new phase: caring for more than one million homeless people.

title: FTC chair Lina Khan wants to do away with noncompete clauses in the US
description: As chair of the Federal Trade Commission, she hopes to streamline the labor market, but there is no guarantee that her initiative will succeed.

title: War in Ukraine: The army unit serving as Kyiv's guardian angel against Russian missiles
description: Air attacks on cities and civilian infrastructure are part of the Russian military's winter strategy, and it is the job of the mobile unit of the 1129th air defense regiment to track aircraft and missiles.

title: Murder of Cameroonian journalist triggers state scandal
description: Several people close to the government were arrested, including powerful counter-intelligence boss Léopold Maxime Eko Eko and businessman Jean-Pierre Amougou Belinga who is suspected of being behind Martinez Zogo's execution.

title: French pension reform: As second week of debates starts, government holds its breath
description: The government is hoping to get its bill passed in the Assemblée Nationale, but is worried about the radicalization of the protests, as the unions say they are ready to 'bring the country to a standstill' on March 7.

title: Pregnant Rihanna soars in Super Bowl halftime performance
description: The pop singer's set included many of her biggest hits and the reveal that she is pregnant with her second child.

title: Berlusconi blames war on Ukraine's Zelensky, PM Meloni repudiates comment
description: Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni's office said Italy's support for Ukraine was 'unwavering' after her ally Silvio Berlusconi blamed the war on Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: In Syria, earthquake damage widens fractures from war
description: The numerous political divisions arising from the civil war have complicated the situation for rescue workers and hampered the delivery of humanitarian aid after the terrible earthquakes of February 6.

title: Portuguese Catholic Church 'sexually abused almost 5,000 children'
description: An independent investigation, which heard from more than 500 victims, found that abuse in the staunchly Catholic country had reached 'epidemic proportions'.

title: Thousands of Israelis protest outside parliament against proposed judicial overhaul
description: The plans have drawn fierce opposition from groups including lawyers and raised concerns among business leaders, widening already deep political divisions in Israeli society.

title: Conservative breakthrough in Berlin puts Chancellor Scholz's coalition under pressure
description: Despite the CDU's progress, the SPD mayor of the German capital, Franziska Giffey, could keep her post.

title: Cambodia: Prime Minister orders closure of independent media Voice of Democracy
description: Voice of Democracy is one of the country's last independent media services and was closed by the Hun Sen after an article was published about his son.

title: Biodiversity: An urgent fight against the disappearance of insects
description: To say that the political response to this phenomenon is not up to par anywhere in the European Union is an understatement. And France is no exception, as evidenced by the recent debate over the authorization of neonicotinoid pesticides.

title: Pension reform: Macron voters defend 'unavoidable' changes
description: The majority of the French president's supporters who spoke with 'Le Monde' accept and justify the reform, although some criticized the bill as 'rushed' and unfair to women.

title: Europe considers sharing procurement to speed up ammunition for Kyiv
description: Estonian Prime Minister Kaja Kallas is proposing that the Commission calls for bids, as it did for Covid-19 vaccines.

title: Macron's juggling act between Algeria and Morocco proves increasingly precarious
description: Algiers has recalled its ambassador to France over the case of activist Amira Bouraoui, while Rabat, buoyed by US recognition of its sovereignty over Western Sahara, is raising the stakes with Paris.

title: David Jolicoeur, founding member of De La Soul, dies aged 54
description: The rapper, who performed under the name 'Trugoy the Dove,' co-founded the legendary trio who changed the face of hip-hop in the late 80s and early 90s.

title: In Turkey,  French rescuers look for quake survivors: 'The only question that matters is: Is there anything more I could have done?'
description: From Osmaniye to Antakya, the first French Civil Protection detachment sent into the country 24 hours after the quake continues to search through the rubble, despite slim chances of finding survivors.

title: Lynx at high risk of (re-)disappearing from France, study says
description: Only about 150 Eurasian lynxes remain in France, where the species had been reintroduced in the 1970s.

title: Uyghurs: Xinjiang governor makes controversial European tour
description: In spite of being sanctioned in the United States for 'serious human rights violations,' Erkin Tuniyaz is touring London, Brussels, and possibly Paris.

title: Algeria 'has entered a dictatorial phase'
description: Researcher Mouloud Boumghar believes that 'the regime has changed its nature,' fearing that street protests will challenge its survival.

title: From Hirak to repression, Algeria enters a new era
description: Nearly four years after a peaceful uprising, the political climate in Algeria is deteriorating as the regime intensifies its crackdown on last dissidents.

title: Paris embraces the cuddles of the Gobelins Teddy Bears
description: Between performance art and naive art, Philippe Labourel's creation has traveled beyond the borders of the 13th arrondissement in Paris.

title: Super Bowl: Chiefs defeat Eagles 38-35
description: Patrick Mahomes and the Kansas City Chiefs overcame the inspired Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts to win their second Super Bowl in four years with a 38-35 win in a magnificent contest on Sunday.

title: In Kazakhstan, the war in Ukraine is pushing McDonald's to pack up and leave
description: The departure of the American company from Kazakhstan highlights the difficulty of the Central Asian republic in emancipating itself from the Russian regime.

title: In Ukraine, the memory of the war is already featured in museums
description: kyiv is holding two exhibitions: One devoted to the invasion led by Russia and its war crimes, the other to the eight-month occupation of Kherson.

title: Biodiversity: 'Neither the magnitude nor the speed of the collapse of insects were anticipated by scientists'
description: In Europe, the abundance of insects could have fallen by nearly 80% over the last three or four decades. It is very likely that our societies are incapable of curbing the race to disaster, explains journalist Stéphane Foucart in his column.

title: Israel says it will legalize nine West Bank settlements
description: The decision, announced on Sunday, comes after a series of attacks in east Jerusalem, including one that killed three Israelis.

title: Five French winter walks by the sea
description: 'Le Monde' is taking you on a trip. Let's go to the island of Ouessant, Argelès, Lacanau, Saint-Malo and Mont-Saint-Michel, popular destinations for summer visitors. They are just as attractive in winter, with the wind in your face. And, supreme luxury, you will (almost) be the only ones to enjoy it.
